poem:
### Balancing Acts

US confidence wobbles,
teetering on a tightrope
of job market spectres.
BoE whispers lullabies
of gradual descents,
each rate drop a feather.
Across the globe,
China's gold dust falls,
a stock market ballet
under scarlet skies.
Economies sway, 
a precarious dance—
each move whispers
of fear and fortune.
